commit_message:
Setup logging to rsyslog for swift

This makes it so Swift logs will be sent to /var/log/swift
instead of staying in journal/syslog

Change-Id: Iee7d5eac496a49b3776d0ded756159dfd821d9e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/31/343031/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Setup logging to /var/log/swift package { 'rsyslog': ensure => present, }-> service { 'rsyslog': ensure => running, enable => true, } file { '/etc/rsyslog.d/10-swift.conf': ensure => present, source => "puppet:///modules/${module_name}/rsyslog-swift.conf", require => Package['rsyslog'], notify => Service['rsyslog'], }-> file { '/var/log/swift': ensure => directory, mode => '0750', }

commit_message:
Create keystone endpoints in keystone profile

This patch enables that if the manage_endpoints flag is set, the
keystone profile will attempt to create the keystone endpoints for
the openstack services.

Change-Id: If3ca24d4aba04d2e406b4c7a51f90f7c57a28fe9
Depends-On: I2470dfa4661be7ba8218f6035fffa05f547214f0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/25/304125/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: include ::ceilometer::keystone::auth include ::cinder::keystone::auth include ::glance::keystone::auth include ::heat::keystone::auth include ::neutron::keystone::auth include ::nova::keystone::auth include ::swift::keystone::auth Keystone_service<||> -> Keystone_endpoint<||>

commit_message:
Run the file injection test case on Ceph envs

Recently we changed the way how file injection is performed: instead
of using nbd or libguestfs, which both modify the image in-place
(and, thus, do not work with Ceph ephemerals), we now place files to
be injected on a config drive and force instances to have config
drives in Nova.

This test case should pass now, when Ceph ephemerals are used. Let's
enable it and actually test, that file injection works as expected.

Related-Bug: #1467860
Related-Bug: #1556819

Change-Id: I5975ea6d481c28856efffb278112306c8760472d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ostf refs/changes/09/325909/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Deployment tags: computes_without_dpdk

subject: Update virsh secret if rbd_keyring or libvirt_rbd_secret_uuid change
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-08 06:57:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova/commit/882dd580ea981e32cbea0f5c36372965b9e63980', 'message': "Update rbd.keyring value if changed

the value of `rbd.keyring` is protected by `creates` defined in
`get-or-set virsh secret`, with this changes, allowing system to
detect if the value of `rbd.keyring` is chnaged or not. If it's
changed puppet will regenerated with required changes, or puppet
will leave it untouched.

Change-Id: I66d343c7c6a4ef0e7ceabe099af00a170f845b2f
Signed-off-by: guessi <guessi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update virsh secret if rbd_keyring or libvirt_rbd_secret_uuid change

This change allows puppet to regenerate the virsh secret or update
its key if one of rbd_keyring or libvirt_rbd_secret_uuid change.

Closes-Bug: 1583998
Related-Bug: 1606918
Change-Id: I66d343c7c6a4ef0e7ceabe099af00a170f845b2f
Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/69/232369/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: is_expected.to contain_exec('undefine-if-changed virsh secret').with( :path => '["/bin", "/usr/bin"]', :command => 'virsh secret-undefine --secret UUID && rm -f /etc/nova/virsh.secret', :onlyif => 'test -z "$(virsh secret-dumpxml --secret UUID 2>/dev/null | grep -w "client.rbd_test")"', :require => 'File[/etc/nova/secret.xml]' ) is_expected.to contain_exec('undefine-if-changed virsh secret').with( :path => '["/bin", "/usr/bin"]', :command => 'virsh secret-undefine --secret UUID && rm -f /etc/nova/virsh.secret', :onlyif => 'test -z "$(virsh secret-dumpxml --secret UUID 2>/dev/null | grep -w "client.rbd_test")"', :require => 'File[/etc/nova/secret.xml]' )

commit_message:
Add 308 to the list of redirect statuses

Some projects use 308 Permanent Redirect, for example Fuel. See
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7538 for more details about this code.

Closes-Bug: 1610914
Change-Id: If026939461cf0cd2ea24558b329b2336679013df

commit_message:
fix unarchive problem

No need to copy to remote machine and then unarchive. The Ansible unarchive module can copy.

Currently, Ansible copies tar.gz files to remote machines. It then runs unarchive, and searches
for the tar.gz files in the local machine. This does not work, except for all-in-one installations.

Change-Id: I2eb894f71a2fd32edc0acd49e8bb353b804930d0

commit_message:
Fix past migration scripts discrepancies

It is important that running all migration scripts from first to last
will give the expected model.

This fix is a first step. It fixes all discrepancies from previous
scripts.

There are still changes in the model that needs to have a migration
script written for them, but that is not handled now.

Change-Id: Ie4079eecef6766ed91c210ccefa058175e0f22d0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/91/352091/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 OpenStack Foundation. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. """fix_past_scripts_discrepancies Revision ID: 014 Revises: 013 Create Date: 2016-08-07 13:12:34.958845 """ # revision identifiers, used by Alembic. revision = '014' down_revision = '013' from alembic import op from sqlalchemy.dialects import mysql from sqlalchemy.engine import reflection def upgrade(): inspect = reflection.Inspector.from_engine(op.get_bind()) ct_unique_constraints = [ uc['name'] for uc in inspect.get_unique_constraints('cron_triggers_v2') ] # unique constraint was added in 001, 002 and 003 with slight variations # without deleting the previous ones. # here we try to delete all three in case they exist if 'workflow_input_hash' in ct_unique_constraints: op.drop_index('workflow_input_hash', table_name='cron_triggers_v2') if 'workflow_input_hash_2' in ct_unique_constraints: op.drop_index('workflow_input_hash_2', table_name='cron_triggers_v2') if 'workflow_input_hash_3' in ct_unique_constraints: op.drop_index('workflow_input_hash_3', table_name='cron_triggers_v2') # create the correct latest unique constraint for table cron_triggers_v2 op.create_unique_constraint( None, 'cron_triggers_v2', [ 'workflow_input_hash', 'workflow_name', 'pattern', 'project_id', 'workflow_params_hash', 'remaining_executions', 'first_execution_time' ] ) # column was added in 012. nullable value does not match today's model. op.alter_column( 'event_triggers_v2', 'workflow_id', existing_type=mysql.VARCHAR(length=36), nullable=True ) # column was added in 010. nullable value does not match today's model op.alter_column( 'resource_members_v2', 'project_id', existing_type=mysql.VARCHAR(length=80), nullable=True )

commit_message:
Added basic Keystone authentication

authenticate() is called outside the constructor
so that the Keystone class plays nicely with
Promises. (It would be weird for the constructor
to return a Promise)

Change-Id: I3f9008d4d954c340178c77ec0433c5a1ddc971d2

added_lines: import fetch from 'isomorphic-fetch'; import Keystone from '../../src/index.js'; import fetchMock from 'fetch-mock'; describe('Openstack connection test', () => { it('should export a class', () => { const keystone = new Keystone(aCloudsConfig('cloud1'), 'cloud1'); expect(keystone).toBeDefined(); it('should throw an error for an unknown cloud', () => { const cloudConfig = aCloudsConfig('cloud1'); const cloudName = 'cloud2'; try { new Keystone(cloudConfig, cloudName); } catch (e) { expect(e).toEqual('Config for this cloud not found'); } }); it('should authenticate', (done) => { const configJson = aCloudsConfig('cloud1'); const auth_url = configJson.clouds.cloud1.auth.auth_url; const cloudName = 'cloud1'; fetchMock .post(auth_url, { body: { catalog: { foo: 'bar' } }, headers: { 'x-subject-token': 'the-token' } }); const keystone = new Keystone(configJson, cloudName); keystone.authenticate() .then(() => { expect(fetchMock.called(auth_url)).toEqual(true); expect(typeof keystone.token).toEqual('string'); expect(keystone.token).toEqual('the-token'); expect(keystone.catalog).toEqual({foo: 'bar'}); done(); }) .catch(reason => { expect(reason).toBeUndefined(); done(); }); }); function aCloudsConfig(name) { const cloudConfig = { clouds: {} }; cloudConfig.clouds[name] = { region_name: 'Region1', auth: { username: 'user', password: 'pass', project_name: 'js-openstack-lib', auth_url: 'http://keystone' } }; return cloudConfig; }

commit_message:
Detach volume when deleting shelved server

When deleting a shelved_offloaded server, nova is pass a
fake connector to cinder for terminate_connection, while
this incorrect connector cause failure for cinder driver.

This patch will extract correct connector for terminate
connection and pass it to cinder, so volume could be
detached after server deletion.

Change-Id: Ic8a46d40fc124940ea64eb1b959750f85619b415
Closes-bug: #1579667

commit_message:
Disable stderr logging

OSLO logging currently defaults the 'use_stderr' option to True
which results duplicate logs in service daemon logs for both
upstart and systemd. To correct this issue the use_stderr
option has been set to false.

Change-Id: I601c764bcb731baeedba784787b721cccfa487e4
Closes-Bug: 1588051
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit e8b360fa224d83f661ce6a5b1eb6fd4360dde082)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ironic refs/changes/90/351390/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix designate bootstrap.

According to
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/designate/getting-started.html#initialize-start-the-central-service
designate database bootstrap to be done by designate-manage database sync.
Was also missing designate-manage pool_manager_cache sync.
designate-manage command is packaged with designate-central.
Boot strap commands moved to designate-central.
Added creation of log directories.
Added python2-oslo-reports and python2-suds for bootstrap to complete.

Change-Id: I97fe3b8047df0e50dd07cf3eb694c362b5507914
Closes-Bug: 1610795
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/09/352309/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: python2-oslo-reports \ python2-suds \ && mv /tmp/policy.json /etc/designate/ \ && chown designate: /etc/designate/policy.jsonCOPY extend_start.sh /usr/local/bin/kolla_extend_start RUN touch /usr/local/bin/kolla_designate_extend_start \ && chmod 755 /usr/local/bin/kolla_extend_start /usr/local/bin/kolla_designate_extend_start

subject: compute: Use stashed connector during local deletes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-12 13:41:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/cad41651ff7bcefae3fd01cc60279c73a0f35c16', 'message': 'compute: Use stashed connector during local deletes

I793f2996fc introduced and made use of a stashed host connector in
the connection_info of each bdm. This should also be used when deleting
instances locally within the compute layer. Allowing any
terminate-connection Cinder calls to complete successfully instead of
using a fake connector that can result in failures for some volume
backends that expect actual connectors to be provided.

Closes-bug: #1415778
Change-Id: I825236502b382f2922af8380d7b3a85a0a4f9af7
'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2016-07-19 12:25:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9a3d92d17df9eebb71e627d0dc2baf8fd2f367cf', 'message': 'compute: Use stashed connector during local deletes

I793f2996fc introduced and made use of a stashed host connector in the
connection_info of each bdm. This should also be used when deleting
instances locally within the compute layer, allowing any
terminate_connection calls to remove the original compute hosts
connection to a given volume.

The continued use of the fake connector during local deletes is a bug as
many cinder volume backends expect additional key values to be present
in the connector dict. For example, FC backends expect wwpns to be
populated. Future work should remove the use of this fake connector and
define the expected contents of a connector in a versioned object.

Closes-bug: #1415778
Change-Id: I825236502b382f2922af8380d7b3a85a0a4f9af7
'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2016-07-27 09:32:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/684a8ef2449ae7a56ebf58ca8acf842e08404bbe', 'message': 'compute: Use stashed connector during local deletes

I793f2996fc introduced and made use of a stashed host connector in the
connection_info of each bdm. This should also be used when deleting
instances locally within the compute layer, allowing any
terminate_connection calls to remove the original compute hosts
connection to a given volume.

The continued use of the fake connector during local deletes is a bug as
many cinder volume backends expect additional key values to be present
in the connector dict. For example, FC backends expect wwpns to be
populated. Future work should remove the use of this fake connector and
define the expected contents of a connector in a versioned object.

Closes-bug: #1415778

I793f2996fc introduced and made use of a stashed host connector in the
connection_info of each bdm. This should also be used when deleting
instances locally within the compute layer, allowing any
terminate_connection calls to remove the original compute hosts
connection to a given volume.

The continued use of the fake connector during local deletes is a bug as

commit_message:
compute: Use stashed connector during local deletes

I793f2996fc introduced and made use of a stashed host connector in the
connection_info of each bdm. This should also be used when deleting
instances locally within the compute layer, allowing any
terminate_connection calls to remove the original compute hosts
connection to a given volume.

The continued use of the fake connector during local deletes is a bug as
many cinder volume backends expect additional key values to be present
in the connector dict. For example, FC backends expect wwpns to be
populated. Future work should remove the use of this fake connector and
define the expected contents of a connector in a versioned object.

Closes-bug: #1415778
Change-Id: I825236502b382f2922af8380d7b3a85a0a4f9af7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/51/340951/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(lyarwood): Attempt to use the stashed connector within # the connection_info of the bdm. If this is not present use a # fake connector to at least attempt to terminate any open # connections to the volume. connection_info = jsonutils.loads(bdm.connection_info) stashed_connector = connection_info.get('connector') if stashed_connector: connector = stashed_connector else: # FIXME(lyarwood): This can lead to failures for volume # backends that expect additional data to be provided # during terminate_connection calls. Cinder should allow # empty connectors to be provided for this use case where # Nova has not already stashed the original. connector = {'ip': '127.0.0.1', 'initiator': 'iqn.fake'}
deleted_lines: # NOTE(vish): We don't have access to correct volume # connector info, so just pass a fake # connector. This can be improved when we # expose get_volume_connector to rpc. connector = {'ip': '127.0.0.1', 'initiator': 'iqn.fake'}

commit_message:
Add functional tests for devstack gate

This patch adds 'functional' tests that will be run by DSVM gate.
A 'cloudsConfig.js' file reads 'clouds.yaml' and converts it to json.
'clouds.yaml' file is searched from the following locations:
 - current directory
 - ~/.config/openstack
 - /etc/openstack
The first file found wins.

For browser, webpack uses a 'yaml' loader and rewrites
'helper/cloudsConfig.js' requirement to 'json!yaml!clouds.yaml'.

A dummy test has been added to demonstrate use of devstack config.

Change-Id: I55909862c70a4cbe22b2820e51c2969d68d8154a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/js-openstack-lib refs/changes/29/345529/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: exclude: /node_modules/, query: { plugins: ['transform-inline-environment-variables'] }

TestCase has a method named config(). Then DbTestCase inherits
from TestCase, and BaseApiTest inherits from DbTestCase.
BaseApiTest also have an attribute named "config" used to
configure the pecan app for tests. So when a test class inherited
from BaseApiTest calls config(), it gets a "Dict is not callable"

This patch rename BaseApiTest.config to BaseApiTest.app_config
to avoid this problem.


Change-Id: I1b020d0ac8d7068bd029fbb4b44b667ec7f01513
'}]
commit_message:
Rename BaseApiTest.config to app_config

TestCase has a method named config(). Then DbTestCase inherits
from TestCase, and BaseApiTest inherits from DbTestCase.
BaseApiTest also have an attribute named "config" used to
configure the pecan app for tests. So when a test class inherited
from BaseApiTest calls config(), it gets a "Dict is not callable"
exception.

This patch rename BaseApiTest.config to BaseApiTest.app_config
to avoid this problem.


Change-Id: I1b020d0ac8d7068bd029fbb4b44b667ec7f01513
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/35/352235/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.app_config = { return pecan.testing.load_test_app(self.app_config)

commit_message:
Datasource configurable update Method

Each datasource had a configurable field
update_method in the vitrage configuration file
where you can set it to update via:
none: don't update i.e. update only via the
periodic changes
pull: updates via polling the datasource every
configurable [changes_interval] seconds
push: updates via the datasource's push notifications

Change-Id: Iab884a357ae7235e137600c95b0a23052cdee064
Closes-Bug: #1606834

added_lines: def get_update_method(conf): """Return the update method for this driver update methods available are: None: updates only via overall snapshots Pull: updates every [changes_interval] seconds Push: updates by getting notifications from the datasource itself :return: the update method of the datasource
deleted_lines: def get_topic(conf): """Return the topic of events processed by this driver Example: to listen to nova topic, add another topic to nova.conf so nova will notify the notifications to another queue. example of nova.conf: notification_topics = notifications,new_topic example of get_topic(): return 'new_topic' :return: the topic of the datasource

commit_message:
Add total count table to per test page

This commit adds a table to the bottom of the per test page that
details the total counts and percentages by status for a particular
test over the selected time window. While the area plot is good to
visualize this overtime, it's not good for figuring out aggregate
data, which is where the table is useful.

Change-Id: I58b0d834fb8e7d74ce1aa7a8020f54a238995ba4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-health refs/changes/31/351831/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Total Test status Counts

Status Count Percentage
Success {{testCtrl.totalCounts.passes}} {{testCtrl.totalCounts.passPercent}}
Failures {{testCtrl.totalCounts.fails}} {{testCtrl.totalCounts.failPercent}}
Skips {{testCtrl.totalCounts.skips}} {{testCtrl.totalCounts.skipPercent}}

Support node capabilities as dictionaries

supports starting with fc05b1bdac1554ec81be9ead55e225cd2f59ccae.

commit_message:
Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim support for
Python 3.5 in the classifier. This patch also adds the convenience
py35 venv.

Change-Id: I7a7485a03f22324d95d7c31e91cbf35c192c2295

commit_message:
Disable IPv6 on bridge devices in linux bridge code

Bridges should not have any IPv6 addresses, either
link-local, or on the tenant's private network due
to the bridge processing Router Advertisements from
Neutron and auto-configuring addresses, since it will
allow access to the hypervisor from a tenant VM.

The bridge only exists for the Neutron security group
code, so we can safely disable IPv6 on it.

Similar to other nova and neutron changes such as
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/313070/

Change-Id: I2ce540b4201cd227c5df53daeb686c4cc49a6e59
Closes-bug: 1302080
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-vif refs/changes/07/351807/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: disv6 = ('/proc/sys/net/ipv6/conf/%s/disable_ipv6' % bridge) if os.path.exists(disv6): processutils.execute('tee', disv6, process_input='1', check_exit_code=[0, 1])

subject: Get mandatory patch attrs from WSME properties
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-31 10:17:49.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/api/controllers/v1/types.py', 'magnum/api/controllers/v1/baymodel.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_bay.py', 'magnum/api/controllers/v1/bay.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_baymodel.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_types.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/92c545ef48b8e662c859431d625a023bef9e96d9', 'message': 'Get mandatory patch attrs from WSME properties

Attributes which are mandatory (ie, required for object creation) should
not be removable. However, some attributes (such as baymodel.server_type)
are not required for object creation, but should not be removable if they
are set. This commit does the following:

- rename JsonPatchType.mandatory_attrs to non_removable_attrs to better
  describe its meaning,
- change its return type to set-of-strings for faster lookup
- ensure all mandatory attributes on the type being patched are
  included in the set of non-removable attributes,
- add a new field, JsonPatchType._extra_non_removable_attrs, which
  should be a set of attributes that are not required for creation but
  should not be removed if set.

Since the object to be patched does not exist at patch-validation time,
we leave the validation logic in methods of JsonPatchType and
subclasses. This means introspecting the types to be patched.

This patch is copied from ironic [1].
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/240202/9

Change-Id: I91802af7e21d00467de8b4727c20602a0b4c2e62
Close-Bug: #1530771
'}]
commit_message:
Get mandatory patch attrs from WSME properties

Attributes which are mandatory (ie, required for object creation) should
not be removable. However, some attributes (such as baymodel.server_type)
are not required for object creation, but should not be removable if they
are set. This commit does the following:

- rename JsonPatchType.mandatory_attrs to non_removable_attrs to better
  describe its meaning,
- change its return type to set-of-strings for faster lookup
- ensure all mandatory attributes on the type being patched are
  included in the set of non-removable attributes,
- add a new field, JsonPatchType._extra_non_removable_attrs, which
  should be a set of attributes that are not required for creation but
  should not be removed if set.

Since the object to be patched does not exist at patch-validation time,
we leave the validation logic in methods of JsonPatchType and
subclasses. This means introspecting the types to be patched.

This patch is copied from ironic [1].
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/240202/9

Change-Id: I91802af7e21d00467de8b4727c20602a0b4c2e62
Close-Bug: #1530771
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/51/349251/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from wsme import types as wtypesclass MyBaseType(object): """Helper class, patched by objects of type MyPatchType""" mandatory = wsme.wsattr(wtypes.text, mandatory=True) _api_base = MyBaseType _extra_non_removable_attrs = {'/non_removable'} def test_cannot_remove_internal_attr(self): patch = [{'path': '/internal', 'op': 'remove'}] ret = self._patch_json(patch, True) self.assertEqual(400, ret.status_int) def test_cannot_add_internal_attr(self): patch = [{'path': '/internal', 'op': 'add', 'value': 'foo'}] ret = self._patch_json(patch, True) self.assertEqual(400, ret.status_int) def test_update_mandatory_attr(self): patch = [{'path': '/mandatory', 'op': 'replace', 'value': 'foo'}] patch = [{'path': '/mandatory', 'op': 'remove'}] def test_cannot_remove_extra_non_removable_attr(self): patch = [{'path': '/non_removable', 'op': 'remove'}] ret = self._patch_json(patch, True) self.assertEqual(400, ret.status_int) self.assertTrue(ret.json['faultstring'])
deleted_lines: @staticmethod def mandatory_attrs(): return ['/mandatory'] def test_mandatory_attr(self): patch = [{'op': 'replace', 'path': '/mandatory', 'value': 'foo'}] patch = [{'op': 'remove', 'path': '/mandatory'}]

The admin creates a bgpvpn resource by specifying a normal user tenant
id. Test checks this user fails to delete the bgpvpn resource.

subject: Fix arg handling when querying statistics.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-04 15:00:35.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/telemetry/v2/statistics.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/telemetry/v2/test_statistics.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/0414c4bb051fdb6d06ea5dde22ffe20627c41ab8', 'message': "Fix arg handling when querying statistics.

Statistics.list() required a different calling convention to pass
generic query arguments than its base class, Resources.list() (from
`openstack.resource`). Resource.list() has a single parameter `params`,
for which a dictionary containing the query arguments can be passed.
Statistics.list() would instead capture all additional keyword arguments
in a dictionary (as in `(..., **params)`).

BaseProxy._list() (from `openstack.proxy`) calls Resource.list() with a
single keyword argument `params`. This leads to the Statistics.list()
implementation receiving the query arguments as a nested dict as in
`{'params': {... actual params ...}}`. This change modifies the
signature of Statistics.list() to match the one of Resources.list().

Change-Id: I7adeceef7291c48f4596888169b6ec7080d1d229
Closes-Bug: #1595453
"}]
commit_message:
Fix arg handling when querying statistics.

Statistics.list() required a different calling convention to pass
generic query arguments than its base class, Resources.list() (from
`openstack.resource`). Resource.list() has a single parameter `params`,
for which a dictionary containing the query arguments can be passed.
Statistics.list() would instead capture all additional keyword arguments
in a dictionary (as in `(..., **params)`).

BaseProxy._list() (from `openstack.proxy`) calls Resource.list() with a
single keyword argument `params`. This leads to the Statistics.list()
implementation receiving the query arguments as a nested dict as in
`{'params': {... actual params ...}}`. This change modifies the
signature of Statistics.list() to match the one of Resources.list().

Change-Id: I7adeceef7291c48f4596888169b6ec7080d1d229
Closes-Bug: #1595453

commit_message:
Add ndg-httpsclient to requirements

Ansible makes use of httplib/urllib for the get_url task. The package
ndg-httpsclient provides the appropriate improvements to support SNI
extensions for SSL certificates which are becoming more commonplace,
causing failures for this task.

Having this package in place along with pyopenssl and pyasn1 will
also get rid of the SNIMissingWarning issued by requests' vendored
urllib3.

The commit history shows development activity in 2016:
https://github.com/cedadev/ndg_httpsclient

I can't speak to whether it's good code.  That is outside my skill
set.

Based on the distribution packages available for it, it does appear
to be Python3 compatible.

The license is BSD, which is compatible.

The package is included in the following distributions:
 - Ubuntu [1] (Xenial only)
 - RHEL/CentOS [2]
 - Fedora [3]
 - Gentoo [4]
 - SuSE [5]

[1] http://packages.ubuntu.com/search?suite=all&searchon=names&keywords=ndg-httpsclient
[2] https://www.rpmfind.net/linux/rpm2html/search.php?query=python-ndg_httpsclient
[3] https://apps.fedoraproject.org/packages/python-ndg_httpsclient
[4] https://packages.gentoo.org/packages/dev-python/ndg-httpsclient
[5] https://build.opensuse.org/package/show/devel:languages:python/python-ndg-httpsclient

Change-Id: I7f90ab6779944bb7e3c9ba4b62fe33058cec6af4

commit_message:
Add gate-tripleo-quickstart-docs-ubuntu-xenial job

tripleo-quickstart recently converted to using sphinx for
documentation. As a result, we can now enable and publish
documentation.

Change-Id: Ie791e7034ef403691cd002c22ffd49164051bbe6
Depends-On: I84c2d8c91d2b1c7efb91fdd857ae985a1b2c6c62
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Rename tripleo-centos-7-ovb to tripleo-centos-7

This is a cosmetic change for nodepool, since this image still only
runs on tripleo-test-cloud-rh1, we need the prefix still.

We'll do this over a series of commits as to not affect running jobs.

Change-Id: Ife98111740232791467523a7f5dd22307b096b1e
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add an action for adding envs to plans

Change-Id: Idb69f72cb703fc79713ee5610a516a604b4bcd6c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/11/351111/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class AddEnvironmentToPlanAction(base.TripleOAction): def __init__(self, container, path, contents): self.container = container self.path = path self.contents = contents def run(self): swift = self._get_object_client() mistral = self._get_workflow_client() env_path = "user-environments/{}".format(self.path) full_path = "{}/{}".format(self.container, env_path) swift.put_object(full_path, contents=self.contents) mistral_env = mistral.environments.get(self.container) mistral_env.variables['environments'].add({ 'path': env_path, })

commit_message:
Manila - Skip running devstack jobs on api-ref/install-guide changes

If a change only contains these files, we don't need to run
DSVM jobs against the change.

Change-Id: I96d8b7a3a0d014f39dd962f94972c5771dc46d04
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/76/352176/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add net-info to openstack-infra jobs

The net-info include extra details about the node that is running,
specifically is the age of our DIB image being launched.  At this info
to openstack-infra jobs so we don't have to look for it in outside
projects.

Change-Id: Ifc0d09f57bb9a10b0d4bb7f18febbc10678f9d60
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Set permissions for /dev/kvm

if we just installed the package, udev rules aren't picked up yet,
so udev may have created the device (/dev/kvm) with default
permissions which affects reduced footprint feature.

Change-Id: I066852220ee75defb6cf1bc364bea32c098fa307
Closes-Bug: #1524978
(cherry picked from commit 4e977279386d0af35f072390249256f3f65dda33)

commit_message:
Correct the wrong description

The context is describing "create project", and the option "--disable"
is for "create project", so there should be 'project', not 'group'.

Change-Id: I64759ea86952d981c4760bcbcfa9880bbc5fc397

subject: Unit tests: Use Properties objects instead of dicts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-05 19:01:01.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_resource.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/05007cf27ae8423266fd01e464b27124ad54e655', 'message': 'Unit tests: Use Properties objects instead of dicts

The Resource.update_template_diff_properties() method takes Properties

Change-Id: I1a00a17aedbf459a3362ea77edf46d8dc5949b22

commit_message:
Unit tests: Use Properties objects instead of dicts

The Resource.update_template_diff_properties() method takes Properties
objects, not just dicts of user values, as arguments. This updates the
tests to pass the correct types.

Change-Id: I1a00a17aedbf459a3362ea77edf46d8dc5949b22

subject: Fix size exceed of dd action when clearing a volume
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-02 11:20:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/174fb5709e6aab214539ef3181b984b65d38c86f', 'message': 'Fix size exceed of dd action when clearing a volume

If user set the config item volume_clear_size to a large
value, and create a volume in size smaller than it.
The "dd" command will get "No space left" error when delete
the volume.

Closes-Bug: #1588310
Change-Id: I690d62bc728c85c9795a87f84b52f1a14474933d
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-04 10:18:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/8e9fb9a3497cb9998796f2765e3ca3da7d576f10', 'message': 'Fix size exceed of dd action when clearing a volume

If user set the config item volume_clear_size to larger value than
a size of a volume, the "dd" command will get "No space left"
error when deleting the volume.

This change rejects volume_clear_size settings that are larger
than 1GB, because there isn't really a reason to set that.
That would be safer all-around.

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1588310
Change-Id: I690d62bc728c85c9795a87f84b52f1a14474933d
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-10 03:21:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/f12bbaa34f4ed2155e699b4bfe34ea289bd1e0b1', 'message': 'Fix size exceed of dd action when clearing a volume

This patch closes two bug that may result in "No space left" error
of dd command.

First:
If user set the config item volume_clear_size to larger value than
a size of a volume, the "dd" command will get "No space left"
error when deleting the volume.
This change rejects volume_clear_size settings that are larger
than 1GiB, because there isn't really a reason to set that.
That would be safer all-around.

Second:
Cinder use such method to calculate dd command is count arguemnt:
count = math.ceil(volume_clear_size / volume_dd_blocksize)
This method is desined for copy volumes, it works OK as we will
check src and dest volume's size firstly. But it result in an
error when we dd from /dev/zero to clear volume, as /dev/zero's
size is 'unlimited'.
We use math.floor when clearing volumes in this patch.

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1588310
Closes-Bug: #1591031
Change-Id: I690d62bc728c85c9795a87f84b52f1a14474933d
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-10 03:24:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/db80958927cca23a3427cf1e002ab81f4fd7549e', 'message': 'Fix size exceed of dd action when clearing a volume

of dd command.

First:
If user set the config item volume_clear_size to larger value than
a size of a volume, the "dd" command will get "No space left"
error when deleting the volume.
This change rejects volume_clear_size settings that are larger
than 1GiB, because there isn't really a reason to set that.
That would be safer all-around.

Second:
Cinder use such method to calculate dd command is count arguemnt:
count = math.ceil(volume_clear_size / volume_dd_blocksize)
This method is desined for copy volumes, it works OK as we will
check src and dest volume's size firstly. But it result in an
error when we dd from /dev/zero to clear volumes, as /dev/zero's
size is 'unlimited'.
We use math.floor when clearing volumes in this patch.

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1588310
Closes-Bug: #1591031
Change-Id: I690d62bc728c85c9795a87f84b52f1a14474933d

This patch closes two bugs that may result in "No space left" error
of dd command.

First:
If user set the config item volume_clear_size to larger value than
a size of a volume, the "dd" command will get "No space left"
error when deleting the volume.
This change rejects volume_clear_size settings that are larger
than 1GiB, because there isn't really a reason to set that.
That would be safer all-around.

Second:
Cinder use such method to calculate dd command's 'count' argument:
count = math.ceil(volume_clear_size / volume_dd_blocksize)
This method is designed for copying volumes, it works OK as we will
check src and dest volume's size firstly. But it result in an

size is 'unlimited'.
We use math.floor when clearing volumes in this patch.

commit_message:
Fix size exceed of dd action when clearing a volume

This patch closes a bug that may result in "No space left" error
of dd command.

If user set the config item volume_clear_size to larger value than
a size of a volume, the "dd" command will get "No space left"
error when deleting the volume.
This change rejects volume_clear_size settings that are larger
than 1GiB, because there isn't really a reason to set that.
That would be safer all-around.

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1588310
Change-Id: I690d62bc728c85c9795a87f84b52f1a14474933d

commit_message:
Provide a mechanism to configure kernel boot parameters

Provide a mechanism to configure kernel boot parameters for the baremetal
nodes, which is primarly needed for enhancing performance of NFV
functionalties like DPDK and SR-IOV. This spec details the changes
involved in ironic components to configure kernel boot parameters.
Though the change is done in the aspect of NFV, the changes shall be
generic and not bound to any particular feature or method of deployment.

Related-Bug: 1592329

Change-Id: I266c73a46ffb07343b258acfe1b85bb4bed76ed1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/64/331564/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================ Configure kernel boot parameters ================================ https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1592329 Provide a mechanism to configure kernel boot parameters for the baremetal nodes, which is primarly needed for enhancing performance of NFV functionalties like DPDK and SR-IOV. This spec details the changes involved in ironic components to configure kernel boot parameters. Though the change is done in the aspect of NFV, the changes shall be generic and not bound to any particular feature or method of deployment. Problem description =================== The performance of the compute node is highly critical especially for hosting VNFs. To obtain optimum performance, features like DPDK and SR-IOV are critical. These features require CPU pinning and huge page features, which has to be specified to the kernel arguments in the boot loader. Today, enabling of these features are done manually, post the cluster installation, by configuring CPU pinning and enabling hugepages. Also the cluster might have a variety of compute resources with different CPU cores and multiple sizes of hugepages, which can enhance going forward. Proposed change =============== A list of boot parameters shall be provided to ironic, which shall be applied to the nodes during the node deploy process. Ironic shall store the boot parameters in the DB and shall be applied to the node at the time of installing bootloader by IPA. Operators can provide boot parameters in multiple ways, since the cluster can contain similar or differential configuration of compute hardware: * On a simple cluster (similar configuration), single set of boot parameters can be given as an input to all the compute nodes, which shall be applied directly * On a complex cluster (differential configuration), multiple set of boot parameters can be given with filters. Ironic shall choose the boot parameters based on the inspected data and the filters provided. * If inspection is not succesfully completed, then only the boot parameters without any filters shall be applied. More details, with examples are explained in the following sections. Alternatives ------------ Post the cluster deploy, kernel boot parameters can be configured manually, which is being followed as of now. Another alternative is to provide the boot parameters in the userdata provided by nova boot and the cloud-init shall configure the grub. We selected the current approach, since bootloader is already installed by ironic, it is appropriate to configure the boot parameters also using ironic. Data model impact ----------------- Ironic Database table ``nodes`` shall have an additional field to store the **processed** boot parameters. The term **processed** implies that the node capabilities has been identified and the given ``args`` and ``filters`` are processed to provide a final list of the boot parameters. The final boot parameters shall be applied to the boot loader of the node. This **processed** boot parameters shall be stored in the database till the node is in ``ACTIVE`` state. On un- provisioning the node, the boot parameters shall be made invalid. ``boot_params`` filed shall be of type String(255) with nullable as True. State Machine Impact -------------------- None REST API impact --------------- This change requires addition of a parameter on the existing provision api. * ``PUT /v1/nodes/(node_ident)/states/provision`` * Existing Parameters * ``node_ident`` * ``target`` * ``configdrive`` * ``clean_steps`` * New Parameter added * ``boot_params`` * Contains a list of kernel boot parameters with corresponding filters to choose best suitable parameters for the node JSON Schema definition of ``boot_params`` `` { "definitions": { "kernel_args": { "type": "object", "properties": { "args": { "type": "string" }, "filter": { "type": "string" }, }, "required": ["args",] } }, "type": "array", "items": { "type": "object", "$ref": "#/definitions/kernel_args" } } `` An example definition with the above schema `` [ { "args": "intel_immou=on" }, { "args": "iolcpus=1-7", "filter": ["vcpus=8"] }, { "args": "iolcpus=1-7,9-15", "filter": ["vcpus=16"] } ] `` Here the ``filter`` shall be compared against the hardware configuration and the ``args`` shall be selected as the boot parameters when the ``fitler`` match the hardware configuration of the node. * Sample 1: For a node with 8 CPUs, the final boot parameters after applying the filter shall be ``intel_immou=on iolcpus=1-7`` * Sample 2: For a node which is not inspected, the final boot parameters shall be ``intel_immou=on`` So the operator has the complete control of defining the expected boot prarameters for even a differential cluster too. Note, that to apply more specific parameters using ``filter``, node introspection is essential. But if the cluster is simple, then the parameters can be applied without any filter too. Client (CLI) impact ------------------- "ironic" CLI ~~~~~~~~~~~~ Client API ``Node.set_provision_state`` shall have an additional argument ``boot_param``, which shall be of above mentioned JSON Schema. "openstack baremetal" CLI ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ None RPC API impact -------------- ``ironic.conductor.manager.do_node_deploy()`` shall have ``boot_params`` passed from the api to conductor via RPC. This function shall be responsible to process the ``args`` for the given ``filter`` and derive the final boot parameter to be applied on the node. After processing, Objects.Node shall be updated with the boot parameters and shall be saved on the database. Driver API impact ----------------- There is no change in the driver api. The flow of installing of boot loader shall have the enhancement of passing on the new boot parameters to the IPA via AgentClient command to install boot loader. IPA impact ---------- Install bootloader command shall have an a new parameter ``boot_params``, which shall be applied to the node at stage of configuring grub.cfg. Nova driver impact ------------------ Nova ironic driver shall pass the newly added argument for provisioning of the nodes. Security impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Scalability impact ------------------ None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- In order to utilize the hardware better, it is important to do introspection of the nodes, to apply the kernel args according to the filter. If introspection is not done, then all the filter based args are ignored and only filter-less args are applied to the node (if any). Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: skramaja Other contributors: Work Items ---------- * ironic client changes for new parameter addition * ironic api changes for new parameter * ironic condutor manager changes for new parameter processing with node spec and coresponding db changes * AgentClient changes to get the params and command it to IPA * IPA changes to apply boot parameters to the node * cleanup on moving out of active state Dependencies ============ * The changes are proposed mainly in the context of deployment of cluster using tripleo. The parameters to ironic shall be passed from heat (from THT) via nova. Testing ======= Unit tests will be added. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== The new parameter is not a mandatory parameter. If it is not provided, then the flow shall be as it is. Documentation Impact ==================== REST API changes need to be documented. References ========== None

commit_message:
Set --use-public option for dlrn execution instead of env var

The tripleo.sh script was relying on some internal functionality
of DLRN to set use the RDO Trunk repos while building packages,
and usage of that env var was changed some time ago. Using the
--use-public command-line switch should fix it and give us the
same behaviour (--dev would change some other behaviour).

Change-Id: If238f34fe5ac9b9990044020d039a281536c47ee

commit_message:
Update the 'get' function of ScheduledOperationState

Add a 'expected_attrs' parameter to the
ScheduledOperationState.get_by_operation_id,
in order to get the state and operation simultaneously.

Change-Id: I4900dd64a9091c53f3a30a72bb8a0cf1a2aeef1e
Closes-Bug: #1608453

added_lines: state_get.assert_called_once_with(self.context, Operation_ID, []) def test_get_state_and_operation(self): ctx = context.get_admin_context() service, trigger, operation, state = FakeEnv(ctx).do_init() state_obj = self.State_Class.get_by_operation_id( self.context, operation.id, ['operation']) self.assertEqual(operation.id, state_obj.operation.id) service, trigger, operation, state = FakeEnv(self.context).do_init() class FakeEnv(object): def __init__(self, ctx): self.context = ctx def do_init(self): service = self._create_service() trigger = self._create_trigger() operation = self._create_operation(trigger.id) state = self._create_operation_state(operation.id, service.id) return service, trigger, operation, state
deleted_lines: state_get.assert_called_once_with(self.context, Operation_ID) service = self._create_service() trigger = self._create_trigger() operation = self._create_operation(trigger.id) state = self._create_operation_state(operation.id, service.id)

commit_message:
Move tempest configuration to test-config phase

Devstack introduce new phase 'tempest_config' in [0].

**test-config** Called at the end of devstack used to configure tempest
or any other test environments.

Reference:
[0] https://review.openstack.org/311797

Change-Id: Ia07405223f021a7fe6c97545a40a725f3bf6de72

commit_message:
Add monasca-common and monasca-statsd to global requirements

Monasca-common and monasca-statsd are already in projects.txt and
this review is to add monasca-common and monasca-statsd into global
requirements to collaborate with other projects to get support and
integration.

Change-Id: Ib93affbf0b8fefe56dd5817b0849a2a8aa43860c

Remove comma from end of policy.json

commit_message:
Bay name must start with alphabets only

Bay name should start with only small or capital letter. Names
can contain small letter([a-z]), capital letter([A-Z]), hypen(-),
digits([0-1]), underscore (_) and periods (.). Names should follow
^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$ regular expression.

Change-Id: I7581f0a99cee5708601b11c571a774acbeace3bd
Closes-Bug: #1605561
(cherry picked from commit c89829622cbdadca04800493046681b50f8fd3c1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/01/349201/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name = wtypes.StringType(min_length=1, max_length=255, pattern='^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$')

commit_message:
Fix usage of account inside gateway/runtime module

After I64a17b455464d407f4ae819ba8d5b12f5be8b77f is landed,
we don't use swift account inside gateway/runtime module,
and only use scope name which is generated based on account
name.

This patch fixes some unit test cases and doc strings based
on the usage of account.

Bonus
This patch also adds some missing docstrings in gateway module.

Change-Id: Id32562164abedf48e0b17e4737dfdd8ac5805d22

[config-ref] update Object Storage container sync configuration

* Split container sync realms configuration into a separate file
* Add description for no help options

(cherry picked from commit 63d3b3efcb6f35c94903f358a348eddc2b8c8228)

commit_message:
Fix GET /executions/<id> to init 'output' attribute explicitly

Change-Id: Ieb2239fd4247ae9a962f85652f1223fa4b91f7fd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/07/352207/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: with db_api.transaction(): wf_ex = db_api.get_workflow_execution(id) # If a single object is requested we need to explicitly load # 'output' attribute. We don't do this for collections to reduce # amount of DB queries and network traffic. hasattr(wf_ex, 'output') return resources.Execution.from_dict(wf_ex.to_dict())

subject: Prevent adding same OVO version twice to history
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-04 11:01:41.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_base.py', 'cinder/objects/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/95d2943b27b5ad673297ccf389607f65f0329344', 'message': 'Prevent adding same OVO version twice to history

Some patches go through a lot of rebases and changes and may end up
mistakenly reusing the same history version as a prior entry.

This is usually caught on review, but just to be sure that this never
gets merged this patch adds a check to the CinderObjectVersionsHistory
add method.

Change-Id: Id5ac41ffcce86c3499e49ad60ac46038567e9fdb
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent adding same OVO version twice to history

Some patches go through a lot of rebases and changes and may end up
mistakenly reusing the same history version as a prior entry.

This is usually caught on review, but just to be sure that this never
gets merged this patch adds a check to the CinderObjectVersionsHistory
add method.

Change-Id: Id5ac41ffcce86c3499e49ad60ac46038567e9fdb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/24/351124/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if ver in self.versions: msg = 'Version %s already exists in history.' % ver raise exception.ProgrammingError(reason=msg)

commit_message:
Use Fedora 24 base image

This is to fix mitaka CI, which is failing since the heat-test-image
rebuild failed.

Closes-Bug: #1534026
(cherry picked from commits 150a013597da2605be34a3971430283fc25946da
                        and 59fc53a66c4dec45e4d150bce0a1d674477f710c)
Change-Id: Ifaccf340f0ff4eac52b1eeef5914b7e90f2687da
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/77/352177/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: curl -L https://download.fedoraproject.org/pub/fedora/linux/releases/24/CloudImages/x86_64/images/Fedora-Cloud-Base-24-1.2.x86_64.qcow2 | openstack image create fedora-heat-test-image --disk-format qcow2 --container-format bare --public if [[ ${PIPESTATUS[0]} -ne 0 ]]; then # The curl command failed, so the upload is mostly likely incorrect. Let's # bail out early. exit 1 fi

"msgid "'%(key)s = %(value)s'" msgstr "'%(key)s = %(value)s'" #, python-formatmsgid "Failed to establish a stable connection" msgstr "安定した接続の確立に失敗しました。" msgid "Get manageable snapshots not implemented." msgstr "管理可能スナップショットの取得は実装されていません。" msgid "Get manageable volumes not implemented." msgstr "管理可能ボリュームの取得は実装されていません。" msgid "" "Retype needs volume to be in available or in-use state, have same encryption " "requirements, not be part of an active migration or a consistency group, " "requested type has to be different that the one from the volume, and for in-" "use volumes front-end qos specs cannot change." msgstr "" "タイプ変更では、ボリュームが利用可能か使用中の状態であること、同じ暗号要求を" "持つこと、アクティブマイグレーションや整合性グループの一部ではないこと、要求" "したタイプが現在のボリュームの一つと異なることが必要です。また、使用中のボ" "リュームのフロントエンド qos 仕様は変更できません。" msgid "Unable to send requests: %s" msgstr "リクエストを送信できません: %s" #, python-format#, python-format msgid "Updating volume metadata is not allowed for volumes in %s status." msgstr "" "ボリュームの状態が %s である場合は、ボリュームメタデータの更新は許可されませ" "ん。" msgid "Volume %(name)s was not deactivated in time." msgstr "ボリューム %(name)s は時間内に非アクティブになりませんでした。" #, python-formatmsgid "Volume %(vol_id)s status must be %(statuses)s" msgstr "ボリューム %(vol_id)s の状態は %(statuses)s でなければいけません。" #, python-format msgid "Volume %(vol_id)s status must be available to extend." msgstr "" "ボリューム %(vol_id)s を拡張するには、状態が「利用可能」でなければいけませ" "ん。" #, python-formatmsgid "" "Volume %s status must be available or in-use, must not be migrating, have " "snapshots, be replicated, be part of a consistency group and destination " "host must be different than the current host" msgstr "" "ボリューム %s の状態は「利用可能」もしくは「使用中」である必要があります。ま" "た、マイグレーション中でないこと、スナップショットを持たないこと、複製されて" "いないこと、整合性グループの一部ではないことも必要で、移行先ホストは現在とは" "異なるホストでなければいけません。" #, python-formatmsgid "Volume does not exists %s." msgstr "ボリュームが存在しません: %s" #, python-formatmsgstr "ファイルは %s に既に存在します。"msgid "marker not found: %s" msgstr "マーカーが見つかりません: %s" #, python-format

commit_message:
Add get_schema() method to Json field type

This patch adds a get_schema() call to Json field type. It is required
in future to generate Json schema out of a field type so that input Json
can be validated.

Change-Id: I8b9f3e037c6b1cd8ca4167b07b62272bfce82bab

commit_message:
Implement two operations for nova server profile

This patch implements two operations for the nova server profile:
reboot, change_password.

Change-Id: Ie19eb75d2368a663034c1d1ae99a85750153ebb9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/70/349770/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_handle_reboot(self): obj = mock.Mock(physical_id='FAKE_ID') profile = server.ServerProfile('t', self.spec) nc = mock.Mock() nc.server_reboot = mock.Mock() nc.wait_for_server = mock.Mock() profile._novaclient = nc # do it res = profile.handle_reboot(obj, type='SOFT') self.assertTrue(res) nc.server_reboot.assert_called_once_with('FAKE_ID', 'SOFT') nc.wait_for_server.assert_called_once_with('FAKE_ID', 'ACTIVE') def test_handle_reboot_no_physical_id(self): obj = mock.Mock(physical_id=None) profile = server.ServerProfile('t', self.spec) # do it res = profile.handle_reboot(obj, type='SOFT') self.assertFalse(res) def test_handle_reboot_default_type(self): obj = mock.Mock(physical_id='FAKE_ID') profile = server.ServerProfile('t', self.spec) nc = mock.Mock() nc.server_reboot = mock.Mock() nc.wait_for_server = mock.Mock() profile._novaclient = nc # do it res = profile.handle_reboot(obj) self.assertTrue(res) nc.server_reboot.assert_called_once_with('FAKE_ID', 'SOFT') nc.wait_for_server.assert_called_once_with('FAKE_ID', 'ACTIVE') def test_handle_reboot_bad_type(self): obj = mock.Mock(physical_id='FAKE_ID') profile = server.ServerProfile('t', self.spec) profile._novaclient = mock.Mock() # do it res = profile.handle_reboot(obj, type=['foo']) self.assertFalse(res) res = profile.handle_reboot(obj, type='foo') self.assertFalse(res) def test_handle_change_password(self): obj = mock.Mock(physical_id='FAKE_ID') profile = server.ServerProfile('t', self.spec) nc = mock.Mock() nc.server_reboot = mock.Mock() nc.wait_for_server = mock.Mock() profile._novaclient = nc # do it res = profile.handle_change_password(obj, adminPass='new_pass') self.assertTrue(res) nc.server_change_password.assert_called_once_with('FAKE_ID', 'new_pass') def test_handle_change_password_no_physical_id(self): obj = mock.Mock(physical_id=None) profile = server.ServerProfile('t', self.spec) # do it res = profile.handle_change_password(obj, adminPass='new_pass') self.assertFalse(res) def test_handle_change_password_no_password(self): obj = mock.Mock(physical_id='FAKE_ID') profile = server.ServerProfile('t', self.spec) profile._novaclient = mock.Mock() # do it res = profile.handle_change_password(obj) self.assertFalse(res) def test_handle_change_password_bad_param(self): obj = mock.Mock(physical_id='FAKE_ID') profile = server.ServerProfile('t', self.spec) profile._novaclient = mock.Mock() # do it res = profile.handle_change_password(obj, adminPass=['foo']) self.assertFalse(res) res = profile.handle_change_password(obj, foo='bar') self.assertFalse(res)

commit_message:
Add 'reboot' and 'change_password' ops for nova server

This adds the reboot and change_password operations to nova server at
the driver layer.

Change-Id: I7272ff350a6ae1852e51d06d0575b40dcf97fe1e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/69/349769/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def server_reboot(self, server, reboot_type): return self.conn.compute.reboot_server(server, reboot_type) @sdk.translate_exception def server_change_password(self, server, new_password): return self.conn.compute.change_server_password(server, new_password) @sdk.translate_exception def wait_for_server(self, server, status='ACTIVE', failures=['ERROR'], interval=2, timeout=None): '''Wait for server creation complete''' if timeout is None: timeout = cfg.CONF.default_action_timeout server_obj = self.conn.compute.find_server(server, False) self.conn.compute.wait_for_server(server_obj, status=status, failures=failures, interval=interval, wait=timeout) return @sdk.translate_exception
deleted_lines: def wait_for_server(self, server, status='ACTIVE', failures=['ERROR'], interval=2, timeout=None): '''Wait for server creation complete''' if timeout is None: timeout = cfg.CONF.default_action_timeout server_obj = self.conn.compute.find_server(server, False) self.conn.compute.wait_for_server(server_obj, status=status, failures=failures, interval=interval, wait=timeout) return @sdk.translate_exception

commit_message:
Documentation for Aodh Scaling Scenario

This patch adds user reference documentation for the autoscaling
scenario where directly invoking ceilometer/aodh command line is
exercised.

Change-Id: I9239fe1c99083bc9faaccb7d51a2260bfd83f1f9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/38/349338/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
DB: add support for volume_type by BDMS

Add volume_type_id to the block_device_mappings database entry.

When booting an instance and creating a volume from the image,
we would like to also be able to specify the volume type. In
order to be able to do that we first need support in
the database.

NOTE: in the Cinder the volume type is a string. In order for
Nova to leverage this we need maintain it as a string.

Partial-bug: #1400310

This is part of the blueprint enable-volume-types

Change-Id: Iaf0ead42ec3df32cbb3301bbde204591b970c4c0

commit_message:
Remove kube-user.yaml

Since the fedora atomic already gets set up with the user "fedora",
we can get rid of the "minion" user since it does not add any value
and it is somewhat confusing logging into master nodes as "minion".

Change-Id: I8c842d08780a786a1568f2d50219e580334ef487
Closes-bug: #1608923

from libvirt service

commit_message:
TrivialFix: Fix a wrong order bug in resource_cleanup()

Super class resource_cleanup method should be called
after class resource cleanup method(s).

Change-Id: Ic56c49c6ca0066a97dcffc6b068dba7320728984

commit_message:
Add description to Scheduled Operation

The description field is used to store
some detail informations for the user.
We should add this field to Scheduled Operation.

commit_message:
Simplify code by using mask_dict_password

A patch to oslo.utils was done to make mask_dict_password() work like
mask_password(). Using mask_dict_password() makes the code simpler and
easier to understand.

Change-Id: I3c34234eca11ff9d58ccdbbdc2d0114bdb6efebb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/32/351932/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: node.driver_info = strutils.mask_dict_password(node.driver_info, "******")

commit_message:
Replace assertEqual(None, *) with assertIsNone in tests

Replace assertEqual(None, *) with assertIsNone in tests to have more
clear messages in case of failure.
And one file was given execution permission by mistake. I remove the 
error permission.

Change-Id: I4ebd9b29b5ab58f58a013f3b594f815cca92fae2
Closes-Bug:#1280522

commit_message:
Need to send 0 values for Gauges

Old code was using if not self.value: which does not work correctly
for a value of 0 which is a valid value for a Gauge

Change-Id: I4a39eaa156676ced5a0c07db781e5292d69a2e60
Closes-Bug: #1610719

commit_message:
Fix unicode issues in tempurl command

Previously, we weren't encoding paths and keys as UTF-8, which would
trigger a UnicodeEncodeError on py27.

Change-Id: I2fad428369406c2ae32343a5e943ffb2cd1ca6ef

commit_message:
Removed a dead db function register_models()

The actual models are created by the migration modules.
register_models() are no longer used and raises some confusions.

Change-Id: I2f63bb4e7a2d4ace9e9d781f63a33153b61aab94
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/93/350393/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def register_models(): """Register Models and create metadata. Called from cinder.db.sqlalchemy.__init__ as part of loading the driver, it will never need to be called explicitly elsewhere unless the connection is lost and needs to be reestablished. """ from sqlalchemy import create_engine models = (Backup, Service, Volume, VolumeMetadata, VolumeAdminMetadata, VolumeAttachment, SnapshotMetadata, Transfer, VolumeTypeExtraSpecs, VolumeTypes, VolumeGlanceMetadata, ConsistencyGroup, Cgsnapshot, Cluster, Worker, ) engine = create_engine(CONF.database.connection, echo=False) for model in models: model.metadata.create_all(engine)

commit_message:
Document query option (is_domain) for projects

The "is_domain" query parameter is missing from GET/UPDATE /v3/projects
documentation in the API site.

Closes-bug: #1609174

commit_message:
Add Magnum-UI plugin support to Horizon

This patch adds Magnum-UI plugin support to Horizon.

Additionally some commenting is added to clarify the purpose of the
developer mode variables.

commit_message:
Add project group to role

This patch adds a var used by the repo_build process to determine
which host group to check for members of before building the pip
packages required by this role. This provides the ability to
optimise the repo build process to only building the packages
that are required for an environment.

Depends-On: Idda16b4f382eee57c7469af898859d6d81d4eb30
Change-Id: Iedb4c0c91daa291f881a9fc00c5b8c40bb312ce3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_horizon refs/changes/64/350964/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This variable is used by the repo_build process to determine # which host group to check for members of before building the # pip packages required by this role. The value is picked up # by the py_pkgs lookup. horizon_role_project_group: horizon_all

commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: Iebd947fc93738e6ccb62460061b00306b96437d6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_horizon refs/changes/01/350001/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set the package install state for distribution packages # Options are 'present' and 'latest' horizon_package_state: "latest"

subject: Don't use versions in _DeprecateSubset
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-05 19:10:32.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/common/_deprecate.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/114de17bf54e0ed588ce1a7c9ec3abf473cd5611', 'message': "Don't use versions in _DeprecateSubset

The _DeprecateSubset helper was developed during Mitaka, but it will
be used for many versions. The version information should not be
hard-coded. Instead we emit deprecation messages without any version
information.

Example warning before this patch:

  DeprecationWarning: IPV6_MODES in version 'mitaka' and will be
  removed in version 'newton': moved to neutron_lib.constants

After:

  DeprecationWarning: IPV6_MODES: moved to neutron_lib.constants

Change-Id: Iaae5b58a406d4021ff22e8a28e30ae4f746ce211
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use versions in _DeprecateSubset

The _DeprecateSubset helper was developed during Mitaka, but it will
be used for many versions. The version information should not be
hard-coded. Instead we emit deprecation messages without any version
information.

Example warning before this patch:

  DeprecationWarning: IPV6_MODES in version 'mitaka' and will be
  removed in version 'newton': moved to neutron_lib.constants

After:

  DeprecationWarning: IPV6_MODES: moved to neutron_lib.constants

Change-Id: Iaae5b58a406d4021ff22e8a28e30ae4f746ce211
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/87/351887/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add proxy config option to google backup driver

Enable users to specify a proxy URL for connecting the cinder
backup service to GCS.

DocImpact: New config option for google backup driver.
Change-Id: I46d2b5d202644269ed44abded3fab8dcc230e3da
Closes-Bug: #1592730
Co-Authored-By: Ollie Leahy <oliver.leahy@hp.com>

commit_message:
Create nova endpoints for tempest test

Horizon tempest tests validate that the Project Overview page is
accessible after logging in. I1b2ddee0395ad9f55692111604b31618c4eaf69e
added permissions to this page, requiring that the compute service be
registered within the keystone catalog.

Add tasks to create the nova service and endpoints to allow the tempest
tests to complete.

Change-Id: Iec0f0f55477464979ef36eb71b9f606348857a52

subject: Fix repo constraints construction and package installation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-03 13:16:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_build/commit/11a6230e85f777c5bf8f63d65f0d3971cef0188b', 'message': "Fix repo constraints construction and package installation

The current repo build process has the following issues:

1. The constraints consruction doesn't properly handle two constraints
   which use the same name, but have different version specs. eg:
   ovs===2.5.0;python_version=='2.7'
   ovs===2.6.0.dev2;python_version=='3.4'
   This is a problem in the constraints construction.

2. The pip packages installed on the repo server in order to
   construct the repo do not respect the global pins or the upper
   constraint overrides.

3. The constraints are selected based on the requirements specified.
   This makes the process unnecessarily complex.

4. The global pins are not applied to the constructed constraints,
   so the wrong packages get built and installed.

This patch corrects all of these issues and hopefully makes the
mechanism for constructing constraints more readily apparent, and
therefore easier to maintain.

Conflicts:
>------tasks/repo_pre_build.yml
>------tests/test-repo-build.yml
>------tests/test-vars.yml

Change-Id: If52d073d43081468e2faf2cd063c4b211c29994f
Related-Bug: #1605846
Closes-Bug: #1609056
(cherry picked from commit 38d7faffa96aa2b03e718320f2dc281cc12029b8)

   which use the same name, but have different version specs. eg:
   ovs===2.5.0;python_version=='2.7'
   ovs===2.6.0.dev2;python_version=='3.4'
   This is a problem in the constraints construction.

2. The pip packages installed on the repo server in order to
   construct the repo do not respect the global pins or the upper
   constraint overrides.

3. The constraints are selected based on the requirements specified.
   This makes the process unnecessarily complex.

4. The global pins are not applied to the constructed constraints,
   so the wrong packages get built and installed.

This patch corrects all of these issues and hopefully makes the
mechanism for constructing constraints more readily apparent, and
therefore easier to maintain.

Conflicts:
>------tasks/repo_pre_build.yml
>------tests/test-repo-build.yml
>------tests/test-vars.yml

This backport also includes corrections to the template from
https://review.openstack.org/350654

Depends-On: Ic473eb9de26a2a3b92e234851b8f731c0255976c
Change-Id: If52d073d43081468e2faf2cd063c4b211c29994f
Related-Bug: #1605846
Closes-Bug: #1609056
(cherry picked from commit 38d7faffa96aa2b03e718320f2dc281cc12029b8)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix repo constraints construction and package installation

The current repo build process has the following issues:

1. The constraints consruction doesn't properly handle two constraints
   which use the same name, but have different version specs. eg:
   ovs===2.5.0;python_version=='2.7'
   ovs===2.6.0.dev2;python_version=='3.4'
   This is a problem in the constraints construction.

2. The pip packages installed on the repo server in order to
   construct the repo do not respect the global pins or the upper
   constraint overrides.

3. The constraints are selected based on the requirements specified.
   This makes the process unnecessarily complex.

4. The global pins are not applied to the constructed constraints,
   so the wrong packages get built and installed.

This patch corrects all of these issues and hopefully makes the
mechanism for constructing constraints more readily apparent, and
therefore easier to maintain.

Conflicts:
>------tasks/repo_pre_build.yml
>------tests/test-repo-build.yml
>------tests/test-vars.yml

This backport also includes corrections to the template from
https://review.openstack.org/350654

Depends-On: Ic473eb9de26a2a3b92e234851b8f731c0255976c
Change-Id: If52d073d43081468e2faf2cd063c4b211c29994f
Related-Bug: #1605846
Closes-Bug: #1609056
(cherry picked from commit 38d7faffa96aa2b03e718320f2dc281cc12029b8)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_build refs/changes/76/350576/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: upper-constraints applied which are sourced from OpenStack and from the global-requirements-pins.txt file. The variable ``repo_build_upper_constraints_overrides`` can be populated with a list of upper constraints. This list will take the highest precedence in the constraints process, with the exception of the pins set in the git source SHAs.
deleted_lines: upper-constraints applied which are sourced from OpenStack. The variable ``repo_build_upper_constraints_overrides`` can be populated with a list of upper constraints.

commit_message:
Change default apt sources to standard Ubuntu sources

The current default apt source ``http://mirror.rackspace.com/ubuntu``
sometimes has broken package indexes or missing packages.

The default package source has therefore been changed to make use of
``http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/`` for packages and
``http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu`` for security packages.

Additionally, in order to allow the sources to be set via a playbook
set fact in OpenStack-CI (to use the OpenStack-Infra mirrors), the
vars are moved to the role defaults. The ensures that that default
values have the lowest precedence.

Change-Id: I294e1f8842fff1ad643db64b506b44f29204f8d0

commit_message:
Fix deprecations in tempest.conf

Some settings in tempest.conf.j2 do not appear
to be supported and or are deprecated according
to tempest docs and code.

This commit correctly applies domain settings.

commit_message:
Add pip to the default package set

This is needed so "pip" will upgrade itself if no other "pip_packages"
have been defined which is needed to unblock gating within the IRR
roles.

Change-Id: I6dd389666500c95023b8f4b76f19a32c55fcb2f7
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Spec - Deploy kolla-kubernetes with Ansible

Change-Id: I20338e222d09dbec8f9c2749d384fa207477e1fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/79/335279/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ==================================== Deploy kolla-kubernetes with Ansible ==================================== POC - Ansible support for Mariadb https://review.openstack.org/#/c/334255/ Deploying and upgrading OpenStack is a workflow. Kubernetes is not a workflow engine and it is not meant to act like one. Kubernetes is good at managing containers and Ansible is good at handing off an organized deployment to be managed. Instead of trying to make Kubernetes into something it isn't, the work could be split by two tools that both specialize in their fields. Problem description =================== In order to do dependancy management in Kubernetes, it requires logic to be added into containers, pods, and/or etcd, so that services will be cluster aware during orchestration. In doing so it requires the developers to account for all scenarios and corner cases when architecting the containers. Use Cases ========= Ansible is capable of handling dependancy management and will be able to orchestrate a cluster and hand it off to Kubernetes to be managed. Arguments ========= Ansible is an additional tool to add to the project. So there is an additional dependancy here. - Ansible wouldn't be adding any complexion though. There would actually be a net reduction on complexion because of the logic required to be built into the containers in order to count for all use cases. Kubernetes will not have complete control over the lifecycle of OpenStack. Ansible will be handeling the bootstrapping, deployment, and the upgrade. - Kubernetes upgrades at the moment only scale down a running container and scale up the new one. OpenStack upgrades are far more complex and require a series of steps to be executes before a service can be successfully upgraded. - Ansible can be removed when the community feels Kubernetes has reached a point where the lifecycle can be fully managed by Kubernetes < Add any pros/cons here so we can track any thoughts on the whether this is a good choice or not > Proposed change =============== Use Ansible to orchestrate pods, service, configmaps, ect... instead of using a workflow like CLI and building logic into the containers. Dependencies ------------ - Ansible > 2.1 Security impact --------------- The endpoint for the Kubernetes master can be assigned on startup. The community can recommend running anisble on the same host as the Kubernetes master. The Ansible Kubernetes module has an outline for SSL support [1], but it's not fully implemented yet. Performance Impact ------------------ Instead of relying on the CLI as a workflow, Ansible will automate everything. Implementation ============== Primary Assignee(s) ----------- Ryan Hallisey (rhallisey) Other contributor(s): Work Items ---------- 1. Merge missing features into Kubernetes Ansible module [2] 2. Build an Ansible play for each service <Please add new work items that are worth mentioning in the spec> Documentation Impact ==================== This should simplify the docs. Instead of a bunch of manually CLI steps things will become more automated. References ========== - [1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-extras/blob/devel/clustering/kubernetes.py#L211 - [2] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-extras/pull/2466

commit_message:
Add stochastic weight handler to scheduler

Add a config option to the scheduler host manager to select host
weight managers other than the default. Rename the existing default
weight manager TopHostWeightHandler because its behavior is to
always choose the top weight. Add a new weight manager which
randomly chooses the host using weights as probabilities.

DocImpact

Implements blueprint stochastic-weighing-scheduler

Change-Id: Ie5985066e68aef25600f8b76948adacd4c04263a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/10/347010/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import ddtimport randomfrom cinder.scheduler.base_weight import WeighedObjectfrom oslo_config import cfg CONF = cfg.CONF @ddt.ddt FAKE_WEIGHTED_OBJS = [ WeighedObject('A', 1), WeighedObject('B', 3), WeighedObject('C', 2) ] @ddt.data( (0.0, 'A'), (0.1, 'A'), (0.2, 'B'), (0.3, 'B'), (0.4, 'B'), (0.5, 'B'), (0.6, 'B'), (0.7, 'C'), (0.8, 'C'), (0.9, 'C'), ) @ddt.unpack def test__lottery_by_weight_correct(self, rand_value, expected_obj): sched = fakes.FakeFilterScheduler() self.mock_object(random, 'random', mock.Mock(return_value=rand_value)) winner = sched._lottery_by_weight(self.FAKE_WEIGHTED_OBJS) self.assertEqual(expected_obj, winner.obj) def test__lottery_by_weight_empty(self): sched = fakes.FakeFilterScheduler() self.assertRaises(ValueError, sched._lottery_by_weight, []) def test__lottery_by_weight_non_list(self): sched = fakes.FakeFilterScheduler() self.assertRaises(AssertionError, sched._lottery_by_weight, 'foo') FAKE_WEIGHTED_HOSTS = [ WeighedObject(fakes.FakeHostState('host1', {}), 3), WeighedObject(fakes.FakeHostState('host2', {}), 2), WeighedObject(fakes.FakeHostState('host3', {}), 1), ] def test__choose_top_host_normal(self): sched = fakes.FakeFilterScheduler() # Mock out stuff we don't want to test self.mock_object(host_manager.HostState, 'consume_from_volume') request_spec = {'volume_properties': ''} # Call the method with default options top_host = sched._choose_top_host(self.FAKE_WEIGHTED_HOSTS, request_spec) self.assertEqual('host1', top_host.obj.host) def test__choose_top_host_stochastic(self): sched = fakes.FakeFilterScheduler() # Mock out stuff we don't want to test self.mock_object(host_manager.HostState, 'consume_from_volume') request_spec = {'volume_properties': ''} # Set the config option to true CONF.set_override('filter_schedule_stochastic', True) # Force a high random number so the last host should be chosen self.mock_object(random, 'random', mock.Mock(return_value=0.99)) top_host = sched._choose_top_host(self.FAKE_WEIGHTED_HOSTS, request_spec) self.assertEqual('host3', top_host.obj.host)
