commit_message:
Update all SHAs for Newton 2016-08-01

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available SHA's,
updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's and also updates the
appropriate python requirements pins.

Change-Id: Icfe4682fe8b7ea6ad41253db3705369ad003f6ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/11/349611/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - setuptools==25.1.1

subject: Move *Image parameters into role templates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 11:29:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/81d0552ca7a30dbe9128dd5cafb92e86b3bc8db2', 'message': "Move *Image parameters into role templates

We've got some inconsistent naming here, but I'm not attempting to
fix that yet, only move the current parameters inside each role template.

This should be backwards compatible because the parameter names
don't change, but also enable progress on custom-roles.  We can
figure out a strategy for deprecating these and aligning per-role
parameter naming in a subsequent patch.

Also moves ImageUpdatePolicy, which wasn't consistently passed to
all roles anyway, and aligns the default image and constraints
for each role.

Change-Id: I85ec979934df220acbab9f7c3a6055f23e3bfc29
Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-26 11:33:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/35c32b72165ace1991203349fc965dd20702a0ed', 'message': "Move *Image parameters into role templates

We've got some inconsistent naming here, but I'm not attempting to
fix that yet, only move the current parameters inside each role template.

This should be backwards compatible because the parameter names
don't change, but also enable progress on custom-roles.  We can
figure out a strategy for deprecating these and aligning per-role
parameter naming in a subsequent patch.

Also moves ImageUpdatePolicy, which wasn't consistently passed to
all roles anyway, and aligns the default image and constraints
for each role.

Change-Id: I85ec979934df220acbab9f7c3a6055f23e3bfc29
Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles

commit_message:
Move *Image parameters into role templates

We've got some inconsistent naming here, but I'm not attempting to
fix that yet, only move the current parameters inside each role template.

This should be backwards compatible because the parameter names
don't change, but also enable progress on custom-roles.  We can
figure out a strategy for deprecating these and aligning per-role
parameter naming in a subsequent patch.

Also moves ImageUpdatePolicy, which wasn't consistently passed to
all roles anyway, and aligns the default image and constraints
for each role.

Change-Id: I85ec979934df220acbab9f7c3a6055f23e3bfc29
Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles

commit_message:
Advanced Option

Allows for an option to be tagged with advanced true/
false, notifying the end user about uncommon usage.
Such an option is not normally used, and will be
moved to the bottom of the respective namespace.
Only options set to true (default: false) will be
tagged as such in generated sample files.

Change-Id: I2689aba283e473bb293bf0cf0c1c4bcb5979d115
Implements: blueprint advanced-option

') try: f.format(opt) except Exception as err: f.write('# Warning: Failed to format sample for %s
' % (opt.dest,)) f.write('# %s
' % (err,)) advanced_opts = [] if opt.advanced: advanced_opts.append(opt) else: _output_opts_format(f, opt) if len(advanced_opts) > 0: for opt in advanced_opts: _output_opts_format(f, opt)

commit_message:
Update help text for certificate generation options

With the changes to the generate_service_certificate-related options
the documentation for the options fell out of sync with what those
options actually do. So this updates them.

bp tls-via-certmonger

Change-Id: I380b344ace180d9d0caf7543c65f4eb664860775

commit_message:
Handle removed dockers in 9.x

During cherry-picking we missed docker-related command. Now it shouldn't
be a problem

commit_message:
Remove deprecated configuration option use_local

UpgradeImpact: This legacy mode was introduced to bridge
a gap during the transition to the conductor service.
It no longer represents a reasonable alternative for deployers.
So we can Remove it in 14.0.

Change-Id: I924efe0e1d1648b742599b508242895e0232ef14

commit_message:
Configure 'stp' per l2_network_device

- use 'stp' configured for each l2_network_device
- use 'stp' option from driver if it wasn't set for the
  l2_network_device (defailt)

Change-Id: I3fc5b9d2267f94310374de962072cf80e40375bf
Closes-Bug:#1608518

Change-Id: I5c5cf6fc07826d14add051b6839a14b6d8429855

commit_message:
Fix kolla docs skip

With the rename of the docs jobs to
end with docs-ubuntu-trusty/docs-ubuntu-xenial, the regex that skipped
all jobs except docs suddenly skipped also the docs job.

Adjust regex for job rename so that job is run for doc only changes.

Change-Id: I5c5cf6fc07826d14add051b6839a14b6d8429855
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/26/351626/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: ^gate-kolla.*(?<!docs-ubuntu-(trusty|xenial))$

added_lines: - Location where syslog sends the logs to. If not set, logging directives from [DEFAULT] without "access\_" will be used. - Syslog facility to receive log lines. If not set, logging directives from [DEFAULT] without "access\_" will be used. - Header to receive log lines. If not set, logging directives from [DEFAULT] without "access\_" will be used. * - ``access_log_headers_only`` = - Syslog logging level to receive log lines. If not set, logging directives from [DEFAULT] without "access\_" will be used. - Label used when logging. If not set, logging directives from [DEFAULT] without "access\_" will be used. - Defines the probability of sending a sample for any given event or timing measurement. If not set, logging directives from [DEFAULT] without "access\_" will be used. - You can use log_statsd_* from [DEFAULT], or override them here. StatsD server. IPv4/IPv6 addresses and hostnames are supported. If a hostname resolves to an IPv4 and IPv6 address, the IPv4 address will be used. * - ``access_log_statsd_metric_prefix`` = - Value will be prepended to every metric sent to the StatsD server. If not set, logging directives from [DEFAULT] without "access\_" will be used. - Port value for the StatsD server. If not set, logging directives from [DEFAULT] without "access\_" will be used. - Not recommended to set this to a value less than 1.0, if frequency of logging is too high, tune the log_statsd_default_sample_rate instead. If not set, logging directives from [DEFAULT] without "access\_" will be used. * - ``access_log_udp_host`` = - If not set, the UDP receiver for syslog is disabled. If not set, logging directives from [DEFAULT] without "access\_" will be used. - Port value for UDP receiver, if enabled. If not set, logging directives from [DEFAULT] without "access\_" will be used. - What HTTP methods are allowed for StatsD logging (comma-sep). request methods not in this list will have "BAD_METHOD" for the <verb> portion of the metric. - By default, the X-Auth-Token is logged. To obscure the value, set reveal_sensitive_prefix to the number of characters to log. For example, if set to 12, only the first 12 characters of the token appear in the log. An unauthorized access of the log file won't allow unauthorized usage of the token. However, the first 12 or so characters is unique enough that you can trace/debug token usage. Set to 0 to suppress the token completely (replaced by '...' in the log). .. note:: reveal_sensitive_prefix will not affect the value logged with access_log_headers=True.

If revealed to an unauthorised person, they can now make requests against an account until the token expires. Set reveal_sensitive_prefix to the number of characters of the token that are logged. For example reveal_sensitive_prefix = 12 so only first 12 characters of the token are logged. Or, set to 0 to completely remove the token.

commit_message:
Deduplicate shrinkwrap file and add file-saver library

This commit changes shrinkwrap file format to use deduplication
feature and to avoid random errors on npm 3.x.

file-saver library was added.

Spec was adjusted for deduplicated shrinkwrap.

Implement blueprint ui-custom-graph

Change-Id: Id1a4a56c3f7eb16070b7f574a3417fbafc1792fd

commit_message:
Remove multi select option on Resource types table

Resource Types panel in Orchestration panel group has a resources
type table.Filter option has been added recently and it brings
checkboxes for each rows by default which is not necessary for this
table action. Hence set multi select option false to remove checkboxes.

Change-Id: Id3fee4fc8c4a67b6ac0057fce92178b8a314e57d
Closes-Bug: #1606328
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/44/347244/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Set permissions for /dev/kvm

if we just installed the package, udev rules aren't picked up yet,
so udev may have created the device (/dev/kvm) with default
permissions which affects reduced footprint feature.

Change-Id: I066852220ee75defb6cf1bc364bea32c098fa307
Closes-Bug: #1524978

Register Mistral service and Mistral endpoints on Keystone::7. Configure transport properties in the corresponding config section: for RabbitMQ it is **oslo_messaging_rabbit**::8. revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-04 19:06:13.000000000', 'files': ['src/index.js', 'package.json', 'test/unit/indexTest.js'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/js-openstack-lib/commit/4e9cf48b43063e83e48f6f04467292040a784cce', 'message': "Enabled fetch-mock with tests.

This patch adds the fetch-mock library, demonstrating how it may be
used to properly mock out API calls. An important change that was
made was the way that 'isomorphic-fetch' was included. Since
fetch-mock makes the assumption that only the window.fetch object
should be overridden, we cannot invoke it via a variable. Instead,

Change-Id: Ibd88b61595b4492f375294a8a08031a1a001a10c
"}]
commit_message:
Enabled fetch-mock with tests.

This patch adds the fetch-mock library, demonstrating how it may be
used to properly mock out API calls. An important change that was
made was the way that 'isomorphic-fetch' was included. Since
fetch-mock makes the assumption that only the window.fetch object
should be overridden, we cannot invoke it via a variable. Instead,
I've simply imported the library, which during import will override
global.fetch if necessary.

Change-Id: Ibd88b61595b4492f375294a8a08031a1a001a10c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/js-openstack-lib refs/changes/43/351343/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: const FetchMock = require('fetch-mock'); describe("Simple test", () => { afterEach(() => { FetchMock.reset(); }); it("should retrieve URL's", (done) => { FetchMock.get("http://example.com/", { status: 200, body: "This is a test" }); let t = new Test(); t.getUrl("http://example.com/") .then((response) => { return response.text(); }) .then((body) => { expect(body).toEqual("This is a test"); done(); }); });

commit_message:
puppet4: make sure database is created before db_sync run

In Puppet4, ordering does matter a lot, and this patch is required to
run Mistral db_sync, otherwise, database will be managed after the
db_sync and it will fail

Change-Id: I2b8beb456ca2e93fa0f25fff1f3512f02272b22e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-mistral refs/changes/02/351402/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ::Openstacklib::Db::Mysql['mistral'] ~> Exec<| title == 'mistral-db-sync' |>

commit_message:
Remove return_netmask function

The return_netmask function was provided as a way to make the inventory
script compatible with the old inventory schema. Since this
compatibility has been broken for about 2 major releases, it can be
simplified.

The function assumed that either the container dictionary would have the
old netmask, or a new netmask would exist, so those are the only return
options. Were neither defined, None would be returned as a standard
Python behavior. Thus, simply using the 'netmask' variable is a viable
alternative; if it's present, it will be used, if it's None, the
behavior is the same as before.

Change-Id: Ibdd3ca9dedbb006c2a668939a931c9547160d56a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/70/349670/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: network['netmask'] = netmask network['netmask'] = netmask
deleted_lines: def return_netmask(): """Return the netmask for a container.""" # TODO(cloudnull) After a few releases this conditional should be # simplified. The container address checking that is ssh address # is only being done to support old inventory. _old_netmask = container.get(old_netmask) if _old_netmask: return container.pop(old_netmask) elif netmask: return netmask network['netmask'] = return_netmask() network['netmask'] = return_netmask()

commit_message:
Add SNI support via OS packages using run_tests.sh

Until bindep can support package names with underscores, this implements
the OS package installs to do the same as a workaround.

Change-Id: I5216305f97c524b580e3b245a11ee2d757132344

added_lines: # This is a workaround until bindep is able to do this for us EXECUTE_TESTS = false bash -c {toxinidir}/run_tests.sh

commit_message:
Add description for personas

This change adds a description to 'The personas' section of the
'Meet the OpenStack personas' doc.

Change-Id: I8d5dffb6dd0f1102ee82398b79eee6074e67d64e
Closes-Bug: 1606671

added_lines: The personas fall into different phases of the cloud adoption workflow based on their specific contribution.
